1.title: Mariupol Self-defense Unit
1.plot: "Mariupol self-defense unit" - a film about people who started the underground struggle against the so-called "DNR" during the occupation of Mariupol and continued to defend the city after Russian army invaded Ukraine. Movie characters - members of Self-defense unit and its commanders.

2.title: From Election to Election
2.plot: "From election to election" - a film about how the electoral field of Mariupol has changed after Euromaidan win, which new political forces appeared and which become less influential. The main focus is on 2015 local elections. Movie characters - the participants of the election process in 2015, public activists.

3.title: Volunteer Day
3.plot: "Volunteer Day" - a film about how a typical day of Mariupol volunteer goes. All areas of volunteer activity are covered - volunteer kitchen for soldiers, material assistance to soldiers of the UAF, assistance for children in need, social activities and participate in elections. Movie characters - 5 Mariupol volunteers.

4.title: Sector M
4.plot: "Sector M" - a film about how to live in front-line villages around Mariupol, what problems people there face and how they decide them, also film shows an interaction between local residents, authorities and ATO soldiers. Movie characters - villagers of Sector "M", local authorities, the UAF soldiers.

5.title: After Minsk
5.plot: "After Minsk" - a film about how life has changed in Mariupol after Minsk agreements in September 2014 and February 2015 were signed, also film tells what Mariupol has to expect after Minsk agreement expiration date. Movie characters - deputy head of ATO Taras Dziuba, Chairman of Donetsk OMCA Pavlo Zhebrivsky, Mayor of Mariupol Vadym Boychenko, commander of the regiment "Azov" Andriy Biletsky, EU Ambassador to Ukraine Yan Tombinskyy, deputy head of the OSCE SMM in Ukraine Alexander Hug, political scientist Maria Podybaylo.

6.title: Black January
6.plot: "Black January" - a film dedicated to shelling of Mariupol by terrorists that took place on January 24th. Film shows this tragedy in context of two other terrorist attacks that have happened that month - Volnovakha bus attack and Donetsk bus shelling incident. Movie characters - former mayor of Mariupol, liquidator of fire, volunteer and victims of shelling.

7.title: First Blood
7.plot: "First blood" - a film about events that took place in Mariupol on May 9th, 2014, when terrorist group "Mongoose" tried to capture Mariupol police department. That was a first battle of Russian-Ukrainian war in Mariupol, and it lead to liberation of Mariupol on June 13th, 2014. Movie characters - participants of those events.

8.title: The New City Power
8.plot: "The new city power" - a film about city authorities which were elected in November, 2015. This film is a logical continuation of film "From election to election". Movie characters - members of all fractions of city council, mayor of the city, political scientist.

9.title: Start Life Again
9.plot: "Start life again" - film about internally displaced persons who came from temporary occupied territories to Mariupol. Movie characters - IDPs who are engaged in different areas: volunteer, soldier, blogger, entrepreneur and civil servant.

10.title: Ukraine Is Mariupol
10.plot: "Ukraine is Mariupol" - the final film from cycle "The city of the heroes". This film tells what people form largest cities of Ukraine (Dnipro, Kharkiv, Kyiv, Lviv and Odesa) know and think about Mariupol. Movie characters - officials and civic activists from these cities, and also their usual citizens.

imdb.plot outline: "The city of the heroes" is a cycle of documentaries about Mariupol. The cycle gives a panoramic view on life of Mariupol in conditions of hybrid warfare in 2014-2016 years. Each film shows a separate part of Mariupol life (elections, self-defense, Minsk process etc.)
imdb.title: Misto heroyiv
plot: "The city of the heroes" is a cycle of documentaries about Mariupol. The cycle gives a panoramic view on life of Mariupol in conditions of hybrid warfare in 2014-2016 years. Each film shows a separate part of Mariupol life (elections, self-defense, Minsk process etc.)
